name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. William GOSS, Jr., Appellant

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, CAPPY and MONTEMURO, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. William GOSS, Jr., Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 1st day of June, . 1993, the order of the Superior Court is vacated and the case is remanded to the trial court for reconsideration in light of Commonwealth v. Jay Smith, 532 Pa. 177, 615 A.2d 321 (1992). William Goss, Jr. is granted leave to amend his post-verdict motions and the Commonwealth is granted leave to file an amended response thereto in light of that opinion.
Jurisdiction is relinquished.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Joshua D. Lock, Harrisburg, for appellant.
Timothy S. Searer, Dist. Atty., for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
625 A.2d 642
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. William GOSS, Jr., Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted May 5, 1993.
Decided June 1, 1993.
Joshua D. Lock, Harrisburg, for appellant.
Timothy S. Searer, Dist. Atty., for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, CAPPY and MONTEMURO, JJ.
